title: Price Elasticity of Supply between 3 and 4 dollars

content.question: What is the price elasticity of supply between <math alttext="$3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>3</mn></math> and <math alttext="$4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>4</mn></math> in the graph above?

choices.label: It is greater than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, and the supply is relatively inelastic.
It is greater than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, and the supply is relatively elastic.
It is equal to <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, and the supply is unit elastic.
It is less than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, and the supply is relatively elastic.
It is less than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, and the supply is relatively inelastic.

content.answer: It is greater than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, and the supply is relatively elastic.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
